titles.title: Rekka no Honoo
烈火之炎
Пламя Рэкки
เปลวฟ้าผ่าปฐพี
Reccanın alevi
烈火之炎
FoR
recca
rnh

Flame of Recca
Flame of Recca
شعلة ريكا

recommendations.recommendation: Great anime. One of my fav but never finshed
Wow, just wow! My favorite tournament anime ever! This is a masterpiece!

anime.description: * Based on shounen manga series by http://anidb.net/cr8521 [Anzai Nobuyuki], originally serialised in http://anidb.net/cr23232 [Shounen Sunday]. http://anidb.net/ch20835 [Hanabishi Rekka], a ninja, is nearly killed in an accident. However, a girl named http://anidb.net/ch20831 [Sakoshita Yanagi] heals him with her powers. Later, the two are tracked down by a woman who attacks them. She tells Rekka to ignite his flame, but he is clueless. Just as she hurts Yanagi, Rekka releases a powerful flame on the woman. She is excited to see this. It turns out that Rekka was born to the Hokage Clan from the past, and was sent to the future in order to escape death. Now, Rekka is the leader of the new Hokage Clan who must stop his older half-brother, http://anidb.net/ch20839 [Kurei], from kidnapping Yanagi.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: alternative present
tag.description: Anime that fit in the alternative present category usually have technology and society that is very similar to ours, but with differences in both, history and culture, which sometimes are blatantly obvious, but sometimes harder to place; this one can at times be very subjective.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: combat
tag.description: Combat involves a violent conflict with the goal to establish dominance over an opponent.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: damsel in distress
tag.description: The damsel in distress is usually a young, nubile woman placed in a dire predicament by a villain or a monster and requires a hero to dash to her rescue. Often used to unite the cast of a show for this one goal, to make them put differences aside and become a band of nakama. Examples: Sakoshita Yanagi from Rekka no Honoo, Yuuki Miaka from Fushigi Yuugi or Higurashi Kagome from Inuyasha.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Resshin
character.description: Leader of the 8 dragons that "live" inside of Recca.

character.name: Chourou
character.description: The eldest of the Hokage clan.

character.name: Joker
character.description: A member of the Uruha who has given his devotion completely to Kurei. True to his name, Joker keeps a carefree and facetious attitude at all times, except when he`s being serious in battle. It`s unknown whether or not he wants to help Recca and crew at times, and he keeps his face a mystery. Is this character a friend or foe?

character.name: Saichou
character.description: Saichou is a member of Team Kuu, as well as it`s second in command. He is good natured, respectful, and friendly teenager. He is extremely devoted to Team Kuu, as is primary movivation for fighting is to prove that his team is not a low level group of thugs and assassins, but fighters who seek pure strength for the sake of strength. Despite being such a powerful fighter at his age, Saichou dislikes causing his enemies in battle unecessary harm, and tried to avoid pointless bloodshed.

episode.title: 火影見参!! 裏武闘殺陣!!
Underground Death Tournament! The Hokage Arrives!!
Hokage Kenzan! Ura Butou Satsujin!!
episode.summary: Recca and the others are invited to the Underground Death Tournament, and are given no choice but to accept. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 甦る過去! 四百年の真実!!
The Past Revived: The 400-Year-Old Truth!!
Yomigaeru Kako! Yon-hyaku Nen no Shinjitsu!!
episode.summary: Gathering at a secret mansion, Kage Hoshi, or rather Kagero, keeps her promise to reveal everything to Recca. She tells the story of his birth, long, long ago. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎激突!! 二人の火影!!
Clash of Flames: The Two Hokage!!
Honoo no Gekitotsu! Futari no Hokage!!
episode.summary: Tokiya lends a hand to Recca, allowing him to continue on to Yanagi. But then Kurei shows up, and reveals some startling truths about Recca`s past. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 水の剣士 復讐の刃!!
The Water Swordsman: The Fang of Revenge!!
Mizu no Kenshi Fukushuu no Yaiba!!
episode.summary: Kage Hoshi reveals some disturbing information after Domon and Recca save Fuko from herself. Overhearing all of this, the next day Tokiya, an older classmate, challenges Recca to a fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎と風神 危険な誘惑!!
Wind and Fire: A Dangerous Seduction!!
Honoo to Fuujin Kiken na Yuuwaku!!
episode.summary: Recca declares that he`s Yanagi`s personal ninja in front of the entire school, which causes all kinds of rumors. Fuko, Recca`s rival, decides to see whether there`s any truth to the claims. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 姫と忍者 めざめた力!!
The Princess and the Ninja: Awakening of the Power!!
Hime to Ninja Mezameta Chikara!!
episode.summary: Recca Hanabishi is the son of a fireworks maker, and a ninja. Or at least, he thinks he is! Since he was young, he`s always felt a deep connection to those shadowy warriors from the past. But when the past comes calling, Recca`s in for a fiery awakening. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鏡の迷宮 決死の火炎!!
Labyrinth of Mirrors: The Flame of Death!!
Kagami no Meikyuu Kesshi no Kaen!!
episode.summary: Domon, Yanagi, and Fuko try to help Recca out of his depression over his loss to Tokiya. But a trip to an amusement park turns deadly when Tokiya challenges Recca once more. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼の土門! 未知なる力!!
Demon Domon: His Unknown Power!!
Oni no Domon! Michinaru Chikara!!
episode.summary: Following the fight against a master of dolls, the group is confronted by a mountain of a man, who takes the descriptor literally. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人形の部屋 風子の死闘!!
The Room of Dolls: Fuko`s Desperate Struggle!!
Ningyou no Heya! Fuuko no Shitou!!
episode.summary: Fuko, Domon, and Recca face off against the Kata Kugutsu madoku user, who can control dolls. But even if they succeed, Kurei has plenty more in store. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 石の番人 死のゲーム!!
Stone Guardian: The Game of Death!!
Ishi no bannin shi no GAME
episode.summary: Rescuing Yanagi will be easier said than done. Kurei`s mansion is filled with deadly tricks and traps, not to mention enemy madogu users. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖の炎術士 紅麗!!
Fearful Fire Sorcerer, Kurei!!
Kyoufu no Enjutsushi Kurei!!
episode.summary: In order to unlock the secret of immortality for his father, Kurei has kidnapped Yanagi. Recca sets off to rescue her, with Domon and Fuko joining him to settle their own scores. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 影の忍軍 火影の謎!!
The Shadow Ninja Clan: The Mystery of the Hokage!!
Kage no ningun Hokage no nazo!!
episode.summary: Recca finds a kindred spirit in the new history teacher, who knows all about the ninja of the past. The visit to the teacher`s home, however, goes wrong when enemies show up to kidnap Yanagi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鋼金晴器! 五つの刃!!
The Five Fangs of Kogonank!!
Kougan Anki! Itsutsu no Yaiba!!
episode.summary: Tokiya fights Koganei while Recca and the others are trapped in the demented Mokuren`s lair. Upon hearing Yanagi`s screams, Recca loses his cool. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎の紅! 死を呼ぶ天使!!
Kurenai the Flame: The Angel of Death!!
Honoo no Kurenai! Shi o Yobu Tenshi!!
episode.summary: Recca and the others face off against Kurei, who reveals the true nature of Hokage fire. It seems impossible to overcome, but Kage Hoshi has one last gambit in mind. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 究極の炎! 伝説の火竜!!
The Ultimate Fire: The Legendary Dragon!!
Kyuukyoku no Honoo! Densetsu no Karyuu!!
episode.summary: With his gauntlet off, the form of Recca`s fire reveals itself. Making a deal with a dragon, Recca turns the heat up on Kurei. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時の呪い! 母と息子!!
The Curse of Time: Mother and Son!!
Toki no Noroi! Haha to Musuko!!
episode.summary: Unsettled by the truth of his birth, Recca turns his anger upon three would-be ninja assassins. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦いの決意! 烈火の挑戦!!
Ready to Fight! Recca`s Challenge!!
Tatakai no Ketsui! Rekka no Chousen!!
episode.summary: Determined to grow stronger for their inevitable showdown with Kurei, Recca attempts to master the eight dragons, while Fuko and Domon train with new madogu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 修羅の剣! 水鏡出陣!!
Sword of Blood! Tokiya in the Ring!!
Shura no Ken! Mikagami Shutsujin!!
episode.summary: The tournament begins, with Recca`s Team Hokage up against the "bandit killers" in Team Kuu. The first match: the staff wielding Daikoku versus Tokiya! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鉄拳不発?! 土門の切り札!!
The Iron Fist Fails! Domon`s Trump Card!!
Tekken Fuhatsu?! Domon no Kirifuda!!
episode.summary: With the conclusion of Tokiya`s fight, it`s time for Domon to step into the ring! But his opponent Minamio has flexibility on his side, literally. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 爆裂!! 乙女の肌の秘密!!
Explosion! The Secret of a Maiden`s Flower!!
Bakuretsu!! Otome no Hada no Himitsu!!
episode.summary: None of the Team Kuu members have been pushovers, but none have been quite so vile and perverted as Fuko`s opponent, Fujimaru! Can Fuko keep her cool, and her shirt? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紙の舞! 吹き込まれた命!!
The Paper Dance: Coming to Life!!
Kami no Mai! Fukikomareta Inochi!!
episode.summary: At last, it`s Recca`s turn to fight. But his opponent Saicho declares he`ll beat Recca in just 10 minutes. What can a guy who controls paper do against fire? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 仏の豹変! もう一つの顔!!
The Other Face: Transformation of the Saint!!
Futsu no Hyouhen! Mouhitotsu no Kao!!
episode.summary: Unable to accept his team`s `easy` win, Recca challenges the leader of Team Kuu, Kukai, to a final showdown to determine everything. But Kukai`s not the saint he`s described as. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 命がけの試練!!
The Life-Staking Test!!
Inochigake no Shiren!!
episode.summary: Kukai`s rampage is unstoppable, and to top it off, he claims he`ll kill Yanagi as well as Recca! But there`s something more to this fight, and Recca just might figure it out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獣の雄叫び 地獄の戦士!!
Beastly Roar: The Warrior from Hell!!
Shishi no Otakebi Jigoku no Senshi!!
episode.summary: The next round of the tournament is upon Team Hokage, but Domon and Fuko have fallen into Kurei`s trap! Rather than lose by default, a certain someone shows up to save the day. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 衝撃!! 電光石火の決着!!
Impact! A Decisive Flash of Lightning!!
Shougeki!! Denkousekka no Kecchaku!!
episode.summary: Now a member of Team Hokage, Koganei faces down Shiju, the chimera. But even after winning, Domon and Fuko are still missing. Koganei will need to fight again, and this time the opponent is someone he knows. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活の木蓮!! 人面樹の驚異!!
Mokuren Resurrected: The Ire of the Human-Faced Tree!!
episode.summary: Mokuren swallows Koganei, earning Team Hokage a loss. Rather than worrying about winning against the reborn serial killer, Tokiya steps into the ring to save Koganei. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二匹の火竜!! 盗まれた技!!
Two Fire Dragons! A Stolen Technique!!
Nihiki no Hiryuu!! Nusumareta Waza!!
episode.summary: In the second round, it`s Recca versus "the Magician" Kashamaru, who specializes in copying techniques he`s seen before. Good thing Recca`s still got some tricks up his sleeve! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見えない敵 恐怖との戦い!!
Invisible Foe! The Battle Against Fear!!
Mienai Teki Kyoufu to no Tatakai!!
episode.summary: With their next opponents too injured to fight, Team Hokage automatically advances to the semi-finals. But Uruha Ma is filled with strange and deadly opponents... and Koganei`s got to fight first! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 呪われし炎 「紅」の過去!!
Cursed Fire! Kurenai`s Past!!
Norowareshi Honoo "Kurenai" no Kako!!
episode.summary: Neon unleashes her requiem, a powerful effect that could kill everyone in the stadium! But why is she willing to go so far for Kurei`s sake? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美女の誘惑 死の二重奏!!
Seduction of the Beauties: Double-Play of Death!!
Bijo no Yuuwaku Shi no Nijuusou!!
episode.summary: In a twist, Neon and Miki challenge Tokiya and Recca to a doubles match. But will the two be able to work past their differences to win, or will Neon sing their swan song? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妖しい唇 言霊の恐怖!!
Dangerous Lips: The Terror of the Kotodama!!
Ayashii Kuchibiru Kotodama no Kyoufu!!
episode.summary: Round three of the tournament, and Team Hokage faces off against Team Uruha Sound. Domon`s up first, but when his opponent starts stripping in the ring, something`s definitely not right. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死闘!! 命燃え尽きるまで!!
Battle of Death! Until Life Is Burned Out!!
Shitou!! Inochi Moetsukiru made!!
episode.summary: It`s the final show down between Kurei and Recca. Flame versus flame, dragon versus phoenix. But Koran Mori still desires immortality, and nothing will stop him from obtaining it! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灼熱の眼光 刹那の瞬炎!!
Scorching Glance!! Setsuna`s Incineration!!
Shakunetsu no Gankou Setsuna no Shun Honoo!!
episode.summary: The final battle of round two has Recca pitted against the leader of Team Uruha Illusion, Genjiro. But Genjiro was never worried about losing... and he`s got his own ideas for what to do with Recca! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決再び!! 烈火と紅麗!!
Second Reckoning! Recca and Kurei!!
Taiketsu Futatabi!! Rekka to Kurei!!
episode.summary: The puzzling Joker forfeits his match with Koganei, leaving only one fight left... against Kurei! In a twist, Kurei takes on all of Team Hokage, but will Recca show up in time? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 涙の訳 乱れ髪の美少女!!
A Reason for Tears: The Young Girl with the Tangled Hair!!
Namida no Wake Midaregami no Bishoujo!!
episode.summary: Recca faces off against Meno, who looks to be nothing more than an innocent schoolgirl. But the vile Genjiro wouldn`t leave anyone with their innocence. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悪女の罠!! 怒りの風神!!
Evil Trap! The Angry Fujin!!
Akujo no Wana!! Ikari no Fuujin!!
episode.summary: Mikoto from Uruha Kurenai has a creepy appearance, but what`s truly frightening is her underhanded tactics! Fuko`s got her work cut out for her, and Recca`s trials against his dragons only get hotter. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 水鏡死闘!! 決死の氷紋剣!!
Tokiya`s Death Match! The Do-or-Die Ice-Crest Sword!!
Mikagami Shitou!! Kesshi no Koori Monken!!
episode.summary: The swordsman Kai steps into the ring, and Tokiya recognizes the blade he wields. Fighting one another, Tokiya learns the truth behind his sister`s death. Meanwhile, Recca confronts his dragons. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖!! 蘇った死者の肉体!!
Terror! The Revived Body of the Dead!!
Kyoufu!! Yomigaetta Shisha no Nikutai!!
episode.summary: A mysterious old man speaks with Team Hokage, imparting sage advice. The next day, a Kurei-less Uruha Crimson shows up to fight Team Hokage... and the first match is the Killer Machine Noroi versus Domon! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔次元脱出!! 亜空間の戦い!!
Escape from the Majigen: Battle in the Evil Dimension!!
Majigen Dasshutsu!! Akuukan no Tatakai!!
episode.summary: Domon`s fight against Magensha continues, but it`s only when Fuko reappears that the real fight begins! Domon`s Ring of Saturn shines brightly. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 火竜合体!! リング外の敵!!
Fire Dragon Combo: The Opponent Beyond the Ring!!
Hiryuu Gattai!! Ring Gai no Teki!!
episode.summary: In the final bout of the semi-finals, it`s the mysterious Magensha versus Domon! But there`s also another Magensha hunting down Yanagi. Which is which? And where did Fuko go? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 乙女の祈り 目覚めた風神!!
A Girl`s Prayer: The Awakening of the Fujin!!
Otome no Inori Mezameta Fuujin!!
episode.summary: With both Fuko and Gashakura at their limits, they put everything on the line. Fuko gains a little help from the Fujin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激闘風子!! 傷だらけの素肌!!
Fuko Fights! A Thin Skin Covered with Wounds!!
Gekitou Fuuko!! Kizu Darake no Suhada!!
episode.summary: Fuko faces off against the heavily armed and armored Gashakura. It`s a fight that pits force against intelligence... and they`re going to have to go all out to see which one will win! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Opening
Ending 1
Ending 2
